comments.body: Would it be worth while to include the camelCase names in the docs with their corresponding snake_case doc snippets?
I don't see how it would hurt, and it would increase searchability for people already familiar with the API. I'll add them.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@
    - The names of module options are snake_cased versions of the camelCase ones found in the
      Keycloak API and its documentation at U(http://www.keycloak.org/docs-api/3.3/rest-api/)

    - The Keycloak API does not always enforce for only sensible settings to be used -- you can set

comments.body:
```
            - dict of registered cluster nodes (with C(nodename) as the key and last registration
              time as the value). This is 'registeredNodes' in KeyCloak REST API.
```

Example of mentioning the upstream api camel case name.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +218,222 @@        description:
            - dict of registered cluster nodes (with C(nodename) as the key and last registration
              time as the value).
              This is 'registeredNodes' in the Keycloak REST API.
        required: false

comments.body:
If the client's lists are not sorted (looking at 'protocolMappers' https://www.keycloak.org/docs-api/3.4/rest-api/index.html#_clientrepresentation) this will incorrectly show True. I'm not sure what they're sorted by, but you could add something along the lines of `new_param_value = sorted(new_param_value, key=lambda k: k['id'])` to your `except TypeError` on [line 536](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/37776/files#diff-73a1f8320d09ef0190fcf41558d5ad90L536)

Does the API return optional parameters as empty or omit them if they weren't provided?
Ahah. Okay, looking at https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/39515/files#diff-73a1f8320d09ef0190fcf41558d5ad90R727, I'm going to take that to mean that protocolMappers are not sorted.

Yeah, protocolMappers returned seem to be unsorted (or sorted by a key I do not know). There are other diff problems in check mode I still need to look at (relating to variable typing and optional fields); the more complex a client definition is the higher the chance it will be bitten by these problems at the moment.

In the more trivial cases this change works. I will take another stab at this when doing a pass to add new Keycloak features (4.0.0 just got released).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +581,585 @@                    result['diff'] = dict(before=sanitize_cr(before_client),
                                          after=sanitize_cr(updated_client))
                result['changed'] = (before_client != updated_client)

                module.exit_json(**result)
